|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The drivers provided by '''RadioLabs''' indicate this device is using an RTL8187(L/B) chipset.
*[http://www.amazon.com/review/RPEH1FVX5THE5/ref=cm_cr_dp_title?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B004AODJ82&channel=detail-glance&nodeID=541966&store=pc This '''Amazon''' review] indicates that the device is simply a repackaged [[ALFA Network AWUS036H]] (w/ a custom made Aluminum / [http://www.amazon.com/review/R25KXPHYLZLUQ9/ref=cm_cr_pr_viewpnt#R25KXPHYLZLUQ9 partial Aluminum shell]). *The reviewer also states the USB WiFi Repeater sold by ''RadioLabs'' is also an [[ALFA Network R36]]. An eBay listing [https://archive.fo/4KKk1 here (archived @ archive.is)] indicates that the top portion is aluminum, the bottom portion is acrylic (or some translucent plastic), [https://web.archive.org/web/20170306042833/http://i.ebayimg.com/images/g/MlAAAOSwGIRXbq~v/s-l1600.jpg and the wireless module used is indeed from an AWUS036H].
[[Category:English Documentation]]
